title: Drawing, "Design for a  Textile", ca. 1801
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gouache and watercolor, graphite, on gray laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
description: Textile design with variations. Two floral designs, upper and lower left, with central posie. Upper background is small yellow flowers, while lower design has denser red vine and flower pattern. Four band designs at right: horizontal stripes bound by gold twists, vertical bands of red circles on yellow, wavy vertical stripes in pink and red, and wavy gold band with small crescents.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a  Textile", ca. 1801.
ca. 1801. Pen and black ink, brush and gouache and watercolor, graphite, on gray laid paper. Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund. 1957-46-19.
